ANDS-Grants.description: This project shifts scholarly attention from viewing informal gold miners as environment destroyers to the context of poverty and rural political economy within which the mining communities operate. This is an urgent priority, which places gold mining as part of an overall agrarian process of livelihood diversification. The research focuses upon three particular informal gold mining communities in Asia, where it will engage with local stakeholders to help ameliorate the livelihood risks and to improve their livelihoods as well as protect the environment. Strategic knowledge networking will occur through a reinvigorated Asia-Pacific Regional Learning Network, to disseminate information on this kind of mining.
ANDS-Grants.title: Linkage Projects - Grant ID: LP130100942

ANDS-Grants.description: This project aims to understand the nexus between intense, cumulative processes of socio-ecological change and emerging forms of social agency. Three case studies of Cambodian and Vietnamese dams, and a review of Thai-Lao cases, will reveal local and civil society responses to nature-society rupture and how these responses affect the region, inform advances in environmental change management, and be relevant to Australia's security policies.
ANDS-Grants.title: Discovery Projects - Grant ID: DP180101495
